greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle with the partial column sums of the octagonal numbers.
comment: "Partial column sums" means the octagonal numbers are the 1st column, the 2nd column are the partial sums of the 1st column, the 3rd column are the partial sums of the 2nd etc.
reference: Albert H. Beiler, Recreations in the Theory of Numbers, Dover (1966), p. 189.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
program: tabl(nn) = {for (n = 1, nn, for (k = 1, n, print1(t(n, k), ", ");); print(););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 04 2014
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 24 2006
